channel.title: Question about joysticks
channel.description: Hi! I'm making a patch with a two 10k potentiometer joystick just like this one: https://www.makerfabs.com/image/cache/makerfabs/Analog%202-axis%20Thumb%20Joystick%20with%20Select%20Button/Analog%202-axis%20Thumb%20Joystick%20with%20Select%20Button_1-1000x750.JPG It works fine, but it only uses half of its capacity movement wise. When i leave it untouched I get both signals at half capacity, that works as intended. But when I move whichever axis I only get to move it halfway before I reach the full signal (or zero, depending on which way I move it). I hope you are understanding what I'm trying to say, english is not my first language and I lack vocabulary in this area. So my question is, those of you that have used joysticks (like this one or similar), have you had the same problem? Did you solve it somehow, or you just left it like that? Edit: I just made a drawing of what I'm trying to explain. The yellow circle is the joystick's full movement, while the green circle is the zone that gives useful values. Over the blue lines, the values I get.

item.title: Question about joysticks
item.dc:creator: @BrianA
item.description:
@BrianA wrote:

Have you measured the x and y pin voltages (with a voltmeter or oscilloscope). I expect you'd see a swing between 0 and 3.3 volts on each axis, but you could verify if it occurs at the extreme of travel or is constrained as per your diagram. That should tell you if it's an issue with the joystick or somewhere in the axo.

Read full topic
